p: Dried S. suffruticosa aerial parts were powdered and sieved using a 300-mesh sieve. The samples (100 g) were placed in a flask and macerated using 400 ml warm water at room temperature (28°C) for 72 hr with occasional stirring. S. suffruticosa samples (50 g) were mixed with 500 ml methanol (98% v/v. Merck, Germany). The mixture was placed in an ultrasonic bath at 40°C and continuously sonicated for 50 min. Extraction was repeated until it became clear. The suspension was filtered through a filter paper to remove solid particles. The residue was placed in an oven (38°C) to dry. The crude extract was stored at -20°C.
